abstract: The key you use to access the optimizer’s learning rate parameter.
overview:
## Discussion

The value type for the [doc://com.apple.coreml/documentation/CoreML/MLParameterKey/learningRate] key is a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/Double].

To modify a model’s learning rate midway through an [doc://com.apple.coreml/documentation/CoreML/MLUpdateTask], use its [doc://com.apple.coreml/documentation/CoreML/MLUpdateTask/resume(withParameters:)] method to set a new value for the model’s learning rate. You do this in the progress handler that you specified in the [doc://com.apple.coreml/documentation/CoreML/MLUpdateProgressHandlers] instance when you created the update task using [doc://com.apple.coreml/documentation/CoreML/MLUpdateTask/init(forModelAt:trainingData:configuration:progressHandlers:)].

See [doc://com.apple.coreml/documentation/CoreML/personalizing-a-model-with-on-device-updates].

# learningRate

**Type Property**

The key you use to access the optimizer’s learning rate parameter.

## Declaration

```swift
class var learningRate: MLParameterKey { get }
```

## Discussion

The value type for the [doc://com.apple.coreml/documentation/CoreML/MLParameterKey/learningRate] key is a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/Double].

To modify a model’s learning rate midway through an [doc://com.apple.coreml/documentation/CoreML/MLUpdateTask], use its [doc://com.apple.coreml/documentation/CoreML/MLUpdateTask/resume(withParameters:)] method to set a new value for the model’s learning rate. You do this in the progress handler that you specified in the [doc://com.apple.coreml/documentation/CoreML/MLUpdateProgressHandlers] instance when you created the update task using [doc://com.apple.coreml/documentation/CoreML/MLUpdateTask/init(forModelAt:trainingData:configuration:progressHandlers:)].

See [doc://com.apple.coreml/documentation/CoreML/personalizing-a-model-with-on-device-updates].

## Accessing model update parameters

- **momentum**: The key you use to access the stochastic gradient descent (SGD) optimizer’s momentum parameter.
- **miniBatchSize**: The key you use to access the optimizer’s mini batch-size parameter.
- **beta1**: The key you use to access the Adam optimizer’s first beta parameter.
- **beta2**: The key you use to access the Adam optimizer’s second beta parameter.
- **eps**: The key you use to access the Adam optimizer’s epsilon parameter.
- **epochs**: The key you use to access the optimizer’s epochs parameter.
- **shuffle**: The key you use to access the shuffle parameter, a Boolean value that determines whether the model randomizes the data between epochs.
- **seed**: The key you use to access the seed parameter that initializes the random number generator for the shuffle option.
